objects.description: The National Cyber Security Centre (UK) authored and published the report, provided YARA rules, analysis, and conclusions. The report is marked UK Crown Copyright and includes NCSC contact information for FOIA queries.

objects.name: coldsteel
objects.description: COLDSTEEL is a fully featured Windows Remote Access Tool (RAT) that provides interactive desktop control and command-line invocation. It supports file operations (copy, move, delete, upload, download), screenshots, simulated user input (keyboard and mouse), process interaction in some variants, session enumeration, and reverse TCP shell. It persists as a Windows service (often masquerading as 'msupdate' or 'msupdate2') and communicates with its C2 using raw TCP sockets on ports such as 443, 8843, and 8888, with custom message formats and optional content obfuscation. The malware is often packed with Themida to evade detection and analysis. Variants are distinguished by hardcoded IDs like MileStone2016, MileStone2017, and FBI20111024, with differences in functionality, communication obfuscation, and OS version handling. Initial access is believed to follow exploitation of Log4j.

objects.name: milestone2016
objects.description: MileStone2016 is a variant of the COLDSTEEL RAT. It persists as a Windows service and uses custom obfuscation of network communications by XORing each content byte with a hardcoded key (observed key basis 0x1C/0x1D). It lacks proper Windows 10 version string support and may leak memory in its basic system survey. It can create a temporary administrator account named ANONYMOUS with password MileSt0ne2@16, run a new instance under this user, then delete the account. Some samples support uninstall via CreateProcessA. It typically lacks Themida packing.

objects.name: milestone2017
objects.description: MileStone2017 is a variant of the COLDSTEEL RAT. It persists as a Windows service commonly masquerading as 'msupdate' or 'msupdate2' and supports Windows 10 version strings in its system survey. Communications are described in detail (custom header, optional content message) and, unlike earlier variants, generally do not use the same content obfuscation. This variant is typically protected using the Themida packer (versions 3.0.5 and 3.1.1).

objects.name: fbi20111024
objects.description: FBI20111024 is an older variant of the COLDSTEEL RAT that lacks proper Windows 10 support and may have a small memory leak during system survey. It includes additional process-related functionality such as process listing and termination and has been observed running under a temporary user account '_DomainUser_' with password 'Dom4!nUserP4ss'. Its communications may be obfuscated and it typically does not use the Themida packer.

objects.name: AhnLab
objects.description: Security vendor referenced as having previously reported on COLDSTEEL. Cited in the introduction as an industry source.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: Security vendor referenced as having previously reported on COLDSTEEL. Cited in the introduction as an industry source with a blog post link.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell
objects.description: COLDSTEEL can run arbitrary commands using cmd.exe.

objects.name: System Services: Service Execution
objects.description: COLDSTEEL executes malicious code as a Windows service.

objects.name: Create or Modify System Process: Windows Service
objects.description: COLDSTEEL creates an autostart service to persist after a system reboot.

objects.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
objects.description: COLDSTEEL is believed to have been deployed following exploitation of Log4j.

objects.name: Obfuscated/Compressed Files and Information: Software Packing
objects.description: MileStone2017 variants of COLDSTEEL have been observed to be packed using Themida as described in Defence Evasion (Themida).

objects.name: Modify Registry
objects.description: COLDSTEEL modifies registry keys directly to add a description to its service.

objects.name: Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion
objects.description: COLDSTEEL has the ability to delete files from the infected machine.

objects.name: Access Token Manipulation: Create Process with Token
objects.description: The MileStone2016 variant of COLDSTEEL has the ability to create a process as the user named ANONYMOUS.

objects.name: System Information Discovery
objects.description: COLDSTEEL collects a range of system information from the infected machine.

objects.name: File and Directory Discovery
objects.description: COLDSTEEL has commands to enumerate the filesystem.

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: FBI20111024 variants of COLDSTEEL have the ability to collect process information.

objects.name: Non-Application Layer Protocol
objects.description: COLDSTEEL communicates over TCP sockets, using a custom message format.

objects.name: COLDSTEEL_service_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule COLDSTEEL_service_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies the service created by COLDSTEEL."
        date = "2023-01-31"
        hash1 = "a94ed3d673261d62f2959979272d8c8d17e6e7f3"

    strings:
        $ = "msupdate"
        $ = "Microsoft Update"
        $ = "Enables the download and installation of Windows updates. If
this service is disabled, this computer will not be able to use the
Automatic Updates feature or the Windows Update Web site."

    condition:
        all of them
}

objects.name: COLDSTEEL_rundll32_use_and_export_names
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
import "pe"
rule COLDSTEEL_rundll32_use_and_export_names
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Execution method used by COLDSTEEL."
        date = "2023-01-31"
        hash1 = "a94ed3d673261d62f2959979272d8c8d17e6e7f3"

    strings:
         $ = "rundll32.exe \"%s\",UpdateDriverForPlugAndPlayDevicesW"

    condition:
        all of them
        and pe.exports("UpdateDriverForPlugAndPlayDevicesW")
        and pe.exports("ServiceMain")
        and pe.exports("DiUninstallDevice")
}

objects.name: COLDSTEEL_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule COLDSTEEL_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "COLDSTEEL strings"
        date = "2023-01-31"
        hash1 = "a94ed3d673261d62f2959979272d8c8d17e6e7f3"

    strings:
        $ = "MileStone201"
        $ = "%SystemRoot%\\System32\\svchost.exe -k "
        $ = "%s SP%d"
        $ = "Win 2003"
        $ = "Win 98"
        $ = "RegSetValueEx(Svchost\\krnlsrvc)"
        $ = "RegOpenKeyEx(Svchost)"
        $ = "RegSetValueEx(ServiceDll)"

    condition:
        7 of them
}

objects.name: COLDSTEEL_Themida_useage
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
import "pe"
rule COLDSTEEL_Themida_useage
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "COLDSTEEL Themida import usage."
        date = "2023-01-31"
        hash1 = "9ec69a042106fc9d27a27197d3b680b468bca9a0"

    strings:
        $ = ".themida"
    condition:
        all of them
        and pe.exports("ServiceMain")

  and pe.imports("CloseServiceHandle", "ADVAPI32")
  and pe.imports("CreateEnvironmentBlock", "USERENV")
  and pe.imports("CreateWindowExA", "USER32")
  and pe.imports("SHGetFileInfoA", "SHELL32")
  and pe.imports("SelectObject", "GDI32")
  and pe.imports("WTSQuerySessionInformationA", "WTSAPI32")
  and pe.imports("strcspn", "MSVCRT")

}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Coldsteel
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. coldsteel.
